Authors: Jaroslava Ovesna, Katarina Mitrova, Ladislav Kucera
Title:
Garlic (A. sativum L.) alliinase gene family polymorphism
reflects bolting types and cysteine sulphoxides content
Keywords:
Allium sativum L., garlic, alliinase, polymorphism,
molecular marker, bolting type
Abstract:
Abstract Background Alliinase is an important enzyme
occurring in Allium species that converts precursors of sulfuric
compounds, cysteine sulfoxides into a biologically active substance
termed allicin. Allicin facilitates garlic defense against pests and
produces health-promoting compounds. Alliinase is encoded by members of
a multigene family that has not yet been sufficiently characterized,
namely with regard to the copy numbers occurring within the genome and
the polymorphisms among the family members.
